content.question: A light is directly above the western end of the track. Ben rides so that at time t, the distance L(t) between Ben and the light satisfies (L(t))2 = 122+(B(t))2. At what rate is the distance between Ben and the light changing at time t=40?

frqParts.text: A light is directly above the western end of the track. Ben rides so that at time t, the distance L(t) between Ben and the light satisfies (L(t))2 = 122+(B(t))2. At what rate is the distance between Ben and the light changing at time t=40?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
